Common Issues

Why People Leave Verizon

Premium Pricing

Verizon charges a premium for their network, with unlimited plans ranging from $70-$90/month before taxes.

Device Payment Lock-in

While there's no traditional contract, device payment plans can keep you tied to Verizon for 24-36 months.

Hard Credit Checks

Verizon requires a credit check that impacts your score and may require a deposit for those with limited credit.

Complex Plan Tiers

Multiple plan levels with different perks make it confusing to know if you're getting the best value.

FAQ

Switching from Verizon

Common questions about making the switch

Absolutely! Your phone number belongs to you, not Verizon. When switching, simply provide your new carrier with your Verizon account number and PIN. Don't cancel Verizon until the port completes, which usually takes minutes to a few hours.

Most newer Verizon phones are unlocked and support multiple networks. Phones from 2020 onwards typically work on AT&T. Check that your phone supports AT&T's bands (2, 4, 5, 12, 14, 17, 29, 30, 66). Verizon will unlock your phone after 60 days of service.

You'll need to pay off your remaining device balance or continue making payments. Verizon won't block your phone for switching, but the payments continue. Some carriers offer trade-in credits or bill credits to help offset this cost.

AT&T and Verizon are both top-tier networks with 99%+ population coverage. AT&T actually has slightly more geographic coverage in rural areas. For most people, there's no noticeable difference in everyday use. Vouch Mobile gives you full AT&T coverage for $30/month.

For the same Verizon network, Visible offers plans from $25/month. However, Vouch Mobile at $30/month on AT&T's network provides better overall value with no data deprioritization and includes features like mobile hotspot that cost extra on Visible's basic plan.
